nodes.comment: I believe that masks are not healthy for children on many levels. Identifying social cues is instrumental in proper development. Masks hinder that development. Also, many kids don’t wash masks so they are breathing in bacteria all day long. Please consider making masks optional. Every person should have the right to choose.
nodes.author: Jennifer Byrley
nodes.extracted: I believe that masks are not healthy for children on many levels.

nodes.comment: No child’s immune system should be compromised by a mask that DOES NOT WORK! I am standing for the children and teachers! Children should not have to suffer because their government is corrupt and can’t make up its mind.
nodes.author: Jerika Whitley
nodes.extracted: I am standing for the children and teachers! [...] Children should not have to suffer because their government is corrupt and can’t make up its mind.

nodes.comment: It’s time to unmask our children and get things back to the way they should be.
nodes.author: Heather Keegan
nodes.extracted: It’s time to unmask our children and get things back to the way they should be.

nodes.comment: Make masks optional for our children
nodes.author: Ashlyn Gioia
nodes.extracted: Make masks optional for our children

nodes.comment: It’s past time to promote Faith over Fear.  This largely does not effect children.
nodes.author: Julie Becker
nodes.extracted: This largely does not effect children.

nodes.comment: It’s ridiculous to have children masked
nodes.author: Nicole Smith
nodes.extracted: It’s ridiculous to have children masked

nodes.comment: Our children deserve better.
nodes.author: Kelly Angotti
nodes.extracted: Our children deserve better.

nodes.comment: Children are at a very low risk from the disease, but masks and isolation are huge psychological risks.
nodes.author: Linda Taylor
nodes.extracted: Children are at a very low risk from the disease, but masks and isolation are huge psychological risks.

nodes.comment:
The right to make decisions for ourselves is being robbed.
Let parents choose what is best for their children.
nodes.author: Shirley Alexander
nodes.extracted: Let parents choose what is best for their children.

nodes.comment: Enough is enough. Let our kids be kids. Stop the madness!!! Unmask our children!!!
nodes.author: Lynne Finch
nodes.extracted: Unmask our children!!

nodes.comment: I believe that parents are the primary decision makers for the health of their children.
nodes.author: K S
nodes.extracted: I believe that parents are the primary decision makers for the health of their children.

nodes.comment: I am signing because our children deserve to be free of these masks. They have been the victims in all of this. Masking our children is child abuse.
nodes.author: Anna Daigle
nodes.extracted: I am signing because our children deserve to be free of these masks. [...] Masking our children is child abuse.

nodes.comment: Children do not need to be masked!
nodes.author: Lauren Carroll
nodes.extracted: Children do not need to be masked!

nodes.comment: Please allow families to make their own choices for our children!
nodes.author: Danielle Jacjson
nodes.extracted: Please allow families to make their own choices for our children!

nodes.comment: We are letting our children be abused with masks for political gains. If the Diocese doesn’t reverse quick, we all need to speak with our pocketbooks and pull our children from this Diocese. The church only understands money, these days.
nodes.author: Joseph Pennington
nodes.extracted: We are letting our children be abused with masks for political gains. [...] If the Diocese doesn’t reverse quick, we all need to speak with our pocketbooks and pull our children from this Diocese.

nodes.comment: Can the leaders in the Catholic Church finally take a courageous stand for Truth rather than parroting and placating our woke culture? Our children’s mental and physical health and well-being are at stake. Be the leaders you are called to be. Be not afraid!
nodes.author: Heidi Maher
nodes.extracted: Our children’s mental and physical health and well-being are at stake.

nodes.comment:
Masks don't prevent disease,  in fact, they cause more illness, fungal infections, staph infections, give kids headaches, cause fatigue, reduce the ability to learn, and are mentally crippling.  
You are teaching children that masks will save them when your JOB is to SHOW them that Jesus is our savior and will save us.  Faith over fear.  Masks have GOT to GO.
nodes.author: Cynthia Caton
nodes.extracted: You are teaching children that masks will save them when your JOB is to SHOW them that Jesus is our savior and will save us.

nodes.comment: MY CHILDREN = MY CHOICE!
nodes.author: Alissa Henrickson
nodes.extracted: MY CHILDREN = MY CHOICE!

nodes.comment: I agree totally with Erika O'Hara. Our children need to breath without restrictions.
nodes.author: Sally Sherwood
nodes.extracted: Our children need to breath without restrictions.

nodes.comment: Masks don’t work. The vaccine doesn’t either. Stop bullying parents and children with non-science pipe dreams. We are awake. We never will be woke.
nodes.author: David Brown
nodes.extracted: Stop bullying parents and children with non-science pipe dreams.

nodes.comment: Masks are proven to be a bacterial nightmare and also slow the development in speech and facial recognition which is essential for young children.
nodes.author: John Wolf
nodes.extracted: Masks are proven to be a bacterial nightmare and also slow the development in speech and facial recognition which is essential for young children.

nodes.comment: Dawn Comstock is harming our children and is not listening to the citizens who pay her salary.
nodes.author: Karen Ryan
nodes.extracted: Dawn Comstock is harming our children and is not listening to the citizens who pay her salary.

nodes.comment: I am my children's voice!
nodes.author: Chelsie Ashbrook
nodes.extracted: I am my children's voice!

nodes.comment: The parents should be able to choose what is best for their children!
nodes.author: Krista Pfeiffer
nodes.extracted: The parents should be able to choose what is best for their children!

nodes.comment: Masks hinder children’s ability to properly communicate
nodes.author: Yan Stastny
nodes.extracted: Masks hinder children’s ability to properly communicate

nodes.comment: I'm signing because we all have the God given right to make decisions like these for our children and ourselves!
nodes.author: Allen Stelwagon
nodes.extracted: I'm signing because we all have the God given right to make decisions like these for our children and ourselves!

nodes.comment: Masking our children should be a parental decision.
nodes.author: ANITA LUKEMEYER
nodes.extracted: Masking our children should be a parental decision.

nodes.comment:
Children need to see the faces of their friends, teachers and fellow students. The ability to discern and interpret  facial expressions is critical to social development! 

There is more evidence that masks are form of control than a medical device to “keep them safe.”
nodes.author: Mary VanCleve
nodes.extracted: Children need to see the faces of their friends, teachers and fellow students.

nodes.comment: Children should be allowed to breathe. Masks are not effective!
nodes.author: Paula Hollingsworth
nodes.extracted: Children should be allowed to breathe.

nodes.comment: I believe in personal choice.  I believe face masks for prolonged periods of time on children is killing Their immune systems
nodes.author: JENNIFER LATTUGA
nodes.extracted: I believe face masks for prolonged periods of time on children is killing Their immune systems

nodes.comment: I’m signing because we don’t live in Afghanistan. Children’s nor anyone faces should be covered. We live in America.
nodes.author: Gina Ushkowitz
nodes.extracted: Children’s nor anyone faces should be covered.

nodes.comment: I’m signing because the children of Florida’s health matters!
nodes.author: Caitlin Ellis
nodes.extracted: I’m signing because the children of Florida’s health matters!

nodes.comment: We must do everything in our power to protect children. Even one child getting sick and/or dying in unacceptable.
nodes.author: Lynn George
nodes.extracted: We must do everything in our power to protect children.

nodes.comment: As a pediatrician who cares for children in the Souderton area, I urge you to follow the expert guidance and require masking of all students and staff.
nodes.author: Kathleen Crocker
nodes.extracted: As a pediatrician who cares for children in the Souderton area, I urge you to follow the expert guidance and require masking of all students and staff.

nodes.comment: Our children need a safe learning environment. It makes NO sense that we hold fire drills to protect them from something that MIGHT happen, but do NOTHING to protect them from something that IS happening!
nodes.author: Virginia Brengle
nodes.extracted: Our children need a safe learning environment.

nodes.comment: Death is permanent. Learning “loss” and socio-economic issues are not. Protect our youngest children.
nodes.author: Mary Juneau
nodes.extracted: Protect our youngest children.

nodes.comment: I’m a physician and a mom to 2 young children and I think putting them in masks is dangerous, developmentally inappropriate and disgusting
nodes.author: Jillian Curran
nodes.extracted: I’m a physician and a mom to 2 young children and I think putting them in masks is dangerous, developmentally inappropriate and disgusting

nodes.comment:
Directors:
How could you approve such a reckless and damnable policy of negating the mask mandate at North Allegheny schools? Did you not stop to think that such a policy will lead to far more quarantining and, therefore, more remote learning (which all too often last year was disastrous)?
You are clearly putting your desire to appease a vocal, irresponsible minority over your responsibility to the children you were elected to serve. I have two grandchildren, who are ineligible for vaccination, in elementary school at NA. I’m outraged that you are jeopardizing their health and safety. 
You can be certain that we will all remember this disgraceful decision at the next election.

Eric Haines,
McCandless
nodes.author: Eric Haines
nodes.extracted: You are clearly putting your desire to appease a vocal, irresponsible minority over your responsibility to the children you were elected to serve.

nodes.comment:
I think CCISD should be doing the correct thing for the children,  not the easy and least political thing. 
The EO is WRONG and dangerous. Those administrators that uphold it are not acting in the best interests  of our kids, they are cowtowing to the loud faction that refused to see the science.
nodes.author: Amanda Rider
nodes.extracted: I think CCISD should be doing the correct thing for the children,  not the easy and least political thing.

nodes.comment: I have never experienced anything harder than watching my child struggle in the ICU. Pediatric ICUs are full of COVID cases already, please keep children safe this fall.
nodes.author: Rhiannon Gallagher
nodes.extracted: Pediatric ICUs are full of COVID cases already, please keep children safe this fall.

nodes.comment: I just don't understand why some parents are so angry and against thier children having to wear masks in school. It's for their own safety! As well as thier families, friends and everyone around them! Don't want them wearing masks, then homeschool them!
nodes.author: Gina Valerio
nodes.extracted: I just don't understand why some parents are so angry and against thier children having to wear masks in school.

nodes.comment: My husband is an Auburn physician and is alarmed at the increase of COVID-19 positive cases in Lee County. Young people, even children have shown to be carriers, and it is unclear how this virus affects children. In Huntsville there are currently children under the age of 9 hospitalised with this virus and complications from it. I urge the ACS to do everything in their power to reduce the spread by mandating masks be worn by staff, parents, faculty and students. It is a simple thing which can help. If children can be taught to wash their hands, brush their teeth or tie their shoes, they can be taught to wear a mask. It’s the responsible thing to do.
nodes.author: Jennifer Canfield
nodes.extracted: Young people, even children have shown to be carriers, and it is unclear how this virus affects children. [...] In Huntsville there are currently children under the age of 9 hospitalised with this virus and complications from it. [...] If children can be taught to wash their hands, brush their teeth or tie their shoes, they can be taught to wear a mask.

nodes.comment: We had 407 cases on Aug 18 and the trend is for these numbers to go up. These are the same levels that we were back in Nov 2020. I think the district should error on the side of caution and protect our children, if the numbers decrease in the next few weeks then make masks optional but in the mean time the district should use measures that worked last year (i.e. masks) to minimize the number of cases so that we can maximize the number of days our children will be able to attend in person.
nodes.author: Jorge Balderas
nodes.extracted: I think the district should error on the side of caution and protect our children, if the numbers decrease in the next few weeks then make masks optional but in the mean time the district should use measures that worked last year (i.e. [...] masks) to minimize the number of cases so that we can maximize the number of days our children will be able to attend in person.

nodes.comment: I believe we as parents have a responsibility to keep our children safe and teach them how to be good citizens by caring for the health and well-being of others.  By not taking COVID precautions seriouslt, the district is at risk of being responsible for an outbreak across the area.
nodes.author: Heather Stevens
nodes.extracted: I believe we as parents have a responsibility to keep our children safe and teach them how to be good citizens by caring for the health and well-being of others.

nodes.comment: I no longer have children in HEB ISD but I still care about keeping all students safe.
nodes.author: Mary West
nodes.extracted: I no longer have children in HEB ISD but I still care about keeping all students safe.

nodes.comment: Child abuse to mask kids especially outside. No data that supports masking children
nodes.author: Joanne Rejevich
nodes.extracted: No data that supports masking children

nodes.comment: This is the least we can do to make sure teachers, staff and our children can all return to school safely!
nodes.author: Jennifer Nemecek
nodes.extracted: This is the least we can do to make sure teachers, staff and our children can all return to school safely!

nodes.comment: I want our children to be in-person for school this year.  By requiring masks, we reduce the opportunity for children to miss days due to illness or quarantining because of a possible contact.  Let’s keep one another safe and our children in school.
nodes.author: Glenn Laverty
nodes.extracted: I want our children to be in-person for school this year. [...] By requiring masks, we reduce the opportunity for children to miss days due to illness or quarantining because of a possible contact. [...] Let’s keep one another safe and our children in school.

nodes.comment: We need to protect our children, especially those who aren’t old enough to be vaccinated!
nodes.author: Jennifer Crawford
nodes.extracted: We need to protect our children, especially those who aren’t old enough to be vaccinated!

nodes.comment: My grandson is beginning kindergarten this year and I am appalled and disgusted that Souderton will not make masks mandatory to keep our children safe. How many deaths will it take?
nodes.author: Alison Lee
nodes.extracted: My grandson is beginning kindergarten this year and I am appalled and disgusted that Souderton will not make masks mandatory to keep our children safe.

nodes.comment: Masks are proven to help and thousands of children use them every day around the world. Our town and our children are just as strong as they are…
nodes.author: Dan Kaufman
nodes.extracted: Masks are proven to help and thousands of children use them every day around the world. [...] Our town and our children are just as strong as they are…

nodes.comment: Protect our children, staff, teachers, and families by wearing a mask. This is not a political issue, it is an endeavor to protect our community and slow the spread of Covid-19. We must get our children and teachers back to school and we should provide them the safest environment possible.
nodes.author: Sarah Superfon
nodes.extracted: Protect our children, staff, teachers, and families by wearing a mask. [...] We must get our children and teachers back to school and we should provide them the safest environment possible.

nodes.comment: Masks are one of the few things shown to help mitigate spread of this virus. It is the right thing to do for our children, staff and teachers. In addition, it is our social responsibility to do everything we can to protect our communities. Children are highly capable and resilient and I have no doubt that with proper training and guidance they will be able to master this skill. What better way to teach them about selflessness, social responsibility, and just doing something that will help others?
nodes.author: Rashmi Rao
nodes.extracted: It is the right thing to do for our children, staff and teachers. [...] Children are highly capable and resilient and I have no doubt that with proper training and guidance they will be able to master this skill.

nodes.comment: The board did a great job through this pandemic keeping our children’s safety a priority over politics. Don’t stop now. If masks have the chance of saving even one child or adult in this community of getting a serious case of COVID then in my opinion it’s worth it. Follow the CDC guidelines.
nodes.author: David Lopez
nodes.extracted: The board did a great job through this pandemic keeping our children’s safety a priority over politics.

nodes.comment: I want the district to follow common sense and science and I want my children to learn it’s important to take care of each other.
nodes.author: Hillary Strong
nodes.extracted: I want the district to follow common sense and science and I want my children to learn it’s important to take care of each other.

nodes.comment: In a pandemic, what one of us does or doesn’t do affects all of us. We should do the absolute most we can to protect our children in schools, which will translate into the rest of our communities.
nodes.author: Lisa Kilheffer
nodes.extracted: We should do the absolute most we can to protect our children in schools, which will translate into the rest of our communities.

nodes.comment: My children are too young to be vaccinated. They will wear masks, but protection means that their peers need to, as well.
nodes.author: Michelle Niculescu
nodes.extracted: My children are too young to be vaccinated.

nodes.comment: Please help protect children for whom vaccines are not available.
nodes.author: Eric Jacques
nodes.extracted: Please help protect children for whom vaccines are not available.

nodes.comment: We have wore masks from the beginning of the recommended time! Why would you not ? My children will wear them to if they are anywhere public!
nodes.author: Claire Becradt
nodes.extracted: My children will wear them to if they are anywhere public!

nodes.comment: Its nessacery to make sure the children are protected and masks is how
nodes.author: Poe Foxen
nodes.extracted: Its nessacery to make sure the children are protected and masks is how

nodes.comment: I care about our children.
nodes.author: Melinda Wood
nodes.extracted: I care about our children.

nodes.comment: Wearing masks is a no brained. The Delta variant is worse than COVID-19. More and more children are winding up in the hospital due to selfish idiots.
nodes.author: Sandra Gatewood-DeLoach
nodes.extracted: More and more children are winding up in the hospital due to selfish idiots.

nodes.comment: I’m a former student and an older sibling to a current 3rd grader. It is ridiculous that there are no mask requirements because it’s ‘hard to enforce’ but no one thought that about my bra strap showing or about my shorts being 1 inch too short while I was attending schools in this county. Beyond that you are risking the lives of not only the students but all faculty members some of which I know have issues that would be complicated with covid. Require masks or do online school not only are you opening yourself up for deaths of children in your care but if I was a parent I would sue the school system if my child was infected because of the lack of safety protocol.
nodes.author: Aly Childers
nodes.extracted: Require masks or do online school not only are you opening yourself up for deaths of children in your care but if I was a parent I would sue the school system if my child was infected because of the lack of safety protocol.
